db:abstract.db:para: A collection of QML Touch Interaction examples.

db:article.db:para: Touch Interaction is a collection of small QML examples relating to touch interaction methods. For more information, visit Important Concepts In Qt Quick - User Input.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Multipoint Flames Example
db:section.db:para: Multipoint Flames demonstrates distinguishing different fingers in a MultiPointTouchArea, by assigning a different colored flame to each touch point.

db:section.db:title: Bear-Whack Example
db:section.db:para: Bear-Whack demonstrates using MultiPointTouchArea to add multiple finger support to a simple game. The interaction with the game is done through a SpriteGoal that follows the TouchPoint. The TouchPoints added to the MultiPointTouchArea are a component with the relevant logic embedded into it:

db:section.db:title: Flick Resize Example
db:section.db:para: Flick Resize uses a PinchArea to implement a pinch-to-resize behavior. This is easily achieved by listening to the PinchArea signals and responding to user input.

db:section.db:title: Flickable Example
db:section.db:para: Flickable is a simple example demonstrating the Flickable type.

db:section.db:title: Corkboards Example
db:section.db:para: Corkboards shows another use for Flickable, with QML types within the flickable object that respond to mouse and keyboard interaction. This behavior does not require special code as the Qt Quick types already cooperate with the Flickable type for accepting touch events.
